title: redRidingHood
sentence: Every day the poor girl would sit beside the spring and spin and spin  until her fingers bled  ~newline~ In the doorway sat an old woman who had such large teeth that the girl felt afraid of her and turned to run away  ~newline~ The girl did her work well  and each day she shook up the bed until the feathers flew about like snowflakes  ~newline~ After the girl had stayed a long time with the kind old woman  she began to feel homesick  ~newline~ When the stepmother saw the girl with her golden dress  she was kind to her  ~newline~ The lazy girl did not spin fast enough to make her fingers bleed  ~newline~ The ugly girl found herself in a beautiful field  just as her sister had  ~newline~ But the lazy girl said to the brown loaves   I will not  ~newline~  I will not   said the girl   for some of your apples might fall on my head   ~newline~ At last the girl stood before the door of Mother Frost s house  ~newline~ For a whole day the girl was very busy  and did everything that she was told to do  ~newline~ This was what the lazy girl wanted  for she felt sure that now she would have the golden shower  ~newline~ The idle girl walked home  covered with pitch  ~newline~ The pitch stuck so fast to the girl that  as long as she lived  it never came off

title: redRidingHood
sentence: The mother loved only the ugly one  for she was her own child  ~newline~ With tears in her eyes  she ran and told her stepmother what she had done  ~newline~ The stepmother was angry and said   You let the spindle fall into the spring  ~newline~ When the stepmother saw the girl with her golden dress  she was kind to her  ~newline~ The mother could hardly wait to have her own child try her luck in the same way

sentence: The maiden went back to the spring to look for the spindle  ~newline~ cried the maiden  ~newline~ cried the maiden  ~newline~ The old woman spoke so kindly that she won the maiden s heart  ~newline~ She took the maiden by the hand and led her to a broad gateway  ~newline~ The gate was open  and as she went through a shower of gold fell over the maiden  ~newline~ Then the gate was closed  and the maiden found herself once more in the world  ~newline~ Then the maiden told how the gold had fallen upon her

title: redRidingHood
sentence: The stepmother was angry and said   You let the spindle fall into the spring  ~newline~  I will gladly work for you   she said  ~newline~ At length she said   Dear Mother Frost  you have been very kind to me  but I should like to go home to my friends   ~newline~  I am pleased to hear you say that you wish to go home   said Mother Frost  ~newline~  That is your pay for having worked so hard   said the old woman  ~newline~ But the lazy girl said to the brown loaves   I will not  ~newline~  I will not   said the girl   for some of your apples might fall on my head   ~newline~  That is what you get for your work   said the old woman  as she shut the gate
